20110103030031.000|20110103030033.000|CC1|DRUGS FOR THE U.S. THAT WERE TOO

20110103030442.000|20110103030442.000|XDS|%    TITLE: 60MIN-4314-002
20110103030442.000|20110103030444.000|CC1|>> Pelley: OF ALL THE THINGS    
20110103030444.000|20110103030445.000|CC1|THAT YOU TRUST EVERY DAY, YOU   
20110103030445.000|20110103030446.000|CC1|WANT TO BELIEVE THAT YOUR       
20110103030446.000|20110103030447.000|CC1|PRESCRIPTION MEDICINE IS SAFE   
20110103030447.000|20110103030448.000|CC1|AND EFFECTIVE.                  
20110103030448.000|20110103030449.000|CC1|THE PHARMACEUTICAL INDUSTRY SAYS
20110103030449.000|20110103030450.000|CC1|THAT IT FOLLOWS THE HIGHEST     
20110103030450.000|20110103030452.000|CC1|STANDARDS FOR QUALITY.          
20110103030452.000|20110103030453.000|CC1|BUT IN NOVEMBER, WE FOUND OUT   
20110103030453.000|20110103030455.000|CC1|JUST HOW MUCH COULD GO WRONG AT 
20110103030455.000|20110103030456.000|CC1|ONE OF THE WORLD'S LARGEST DRUG 
20110103030456.000|20110103030459.000|CC1|MAKERS.                         
20110103030459.000|20110103030501.000|CC1|A SUBSIDIARY OF GLAXOSMITHKLINE 
20110103030501.000|20110103030502.000|CC1|PLEADED GUILTY TO DISTRIBUTING  
20110103030502.000|20110103030504.000|CC1|ADULTERATED DRUGS.              
20110103030504.000|20110103030505.000|CC1|THERE WAS REASON TO BELIEVE SOME
20110103030505.000|20110103030507.000|CC1|OF THE MEDICATIONS WERE         
20110103030507.000|20110103030508.000|CC1|CONTAMINATED WITH BACTERIA,     
20110103030508.000|20110103030510.000|CC1|OTHERS WERE MISLABELED, AND SOME
20110103030510.000|20110103030510.000|CC1|WERE TOO STRONG OR NOT STRONG   
20110103030510.000|20110103030513.000|CC1|ENOUGH.                         
20110103030513.000|20110103030514.000|CC1|IT'S LIKELY THAT GLAXO WOULD    
20110103030514.000|20110103030515.000|CC1|HAVE GOTTEN AWAY WITH IT HAD IT 
20110103030515.000|20110103030519.000|CC1|NOT BEEN FOR A COMPANY INSIDER. 
20110103030519.000|20110103030520.000|CC1|A TIP FROM CHERYL ECKARD SET OFF
20110103030520.000|20110103030524.000|CC1|A MAJOR FEDERAL INVESTIGATION.  
20110103030524.000|20110103030525.000|CC1|SHE'S NEVER TOLD THE PUBLIC WHAT
20110103030525.000|20110103030526.000|CC1|SHE SAW INSIDE GLAXO, BUT       
20110103030526.000|20110103030529.000|CC1|TONIGHT, SHE WILL.              
20110103030529.000|20110103030531.000|CC1|HER STORY OPENS A RARE WINDOW ON
20110103030531.000|20110103030532.000|CC1|HOW ONE COMPANY TRADED ITS GOOD 
20110103030532.000|20110103030536.000|CC1|NAME FOR BAD MEDICINE.          
20110103030536.000|20110103030538.000|CC1|CHERYL ECKARD WORKED IN GLAXO   
20110103030538.000|20110103030540.000|CC1|QUALITY CONTROL, AND OVER TEN   
20110103030540.000|20110103030541.000|CC1|YEARS, SHE'D RISEN TO BECOME A  
20110103030541.000|20110103030542.000|CC1|MANAGER OF GLOBAL QUALITY       
20110103030542.000|20110103030545.000|CC1|ASSURANCE.                      
20110103030545.000|20110103030547.000|CC1|HER JOB WAS TO INSPECT PLANTS,  
20110103030547.000|20110103030549.000|CC1|LIKE THIS GLAXO FACILITY IN     
20110103030549.000|20110103030550.000|CC1|NORTH CAROLINA, TO MAKE SURE    
20110103030550.000|20110103030552.000|CC1|THAT THE DRUGS HAD THE RIGHT    
20110103030552.000|20110103030554.000|CC1|INGREDIENTS, THE RIGHT POTENCY, 
20110103030554.000|20110103030555.000|CC1|AND MET GOVERNMENT STANDARDS FOR
20110103030555.000|20110103030558.000|CC1|PURITY.                         
20110103030558.000|20110103030559.000|CC1|IN 2002, ECKARD WAS ASSIGNED TO 
20110103030559.000|20110103030601.000|CC1|HELP LEAD A QUALITY ASSURANCE   
20110103030601.000|20110103030603.000|CC1|TEAM TO EVALUATE ONE OF GLAXO'S 
20110103030603.000|20110103030604.000|CC1|MOST IMPORTANT PLANTS, IN CIDRA,
20110103030604.000|20110103030608.000|CC1|PUERTO RICO.                    
20110103030608.000|20110103030610.000|CC1|900 PEOPLE WORKED HERE MAKING 20
20110103030610.000|20110103030614.000|CC1|DRUGS FOR PATIENTS IN THE U.S.  
20110103030614.000|20110103030615.000|CC1|BUT ECKARD SAYS THAT WHEN SHE   
20110103030615.000|20110103030616.000|CC1|SAW WHAT WAS HAPPENING TO SOME  
20110103030616.000|20110103030618.000|CC1|OF THE COMPANY'S MOST POPULAR   
20110103030618.000|20110103030620.000|CC1|DRUGS, SHE COULDN'T BELIEVE IT. 
20110103030620.000|20110103030621.000|CC1|>> Cheryl Eckard: ALL THE       
20110103030621.000|20110103030623.000|CC1|SYSTEMS WERE BROKEN, THE        
20110103030623.000|20110103030624.000|CC1|FACILITY WAS BROKEN, THE        
20110103030624.000|20110103030626.000|CC1|EQUIPMENT WAS BROKEN, THE       
20110103030626.000|20110103030631.000|CC1|PROCESSES WERE BROKEN.          
20110103030631.000|20110103030632.000|CC1|IT WAS THE WORST THING I HAD RUN
20110103030632.000|20110103030636.000|CC1|ACROSS IN MY CAREER.            
20110103030636.000|20110103030637.000|CC1|>> Pelley: THE WORST, BECAUSE SO
20110103030637.000|20110103030638.000|CC1|MANY THINGS BEHIND THESE WALLS  
20110103030638.000|20110103030640.000|CC1|WERE GOING WRONG AT ONCE.       
20110103030640.000|20110103030641.000|CC1|ECKARD SAYS WATER USED TO MAKE  
20110103030641.000|20110103030642.000|CC1|TABLETS WAS TAINTED WITH        
20110103030642.000|20110103030645.000|CC1|BACTERIA.                       
20110103030645.000|20110103030646.000|CC1|FAILURES ON PRODUCTION LINES    
20110103030646.000|20110103030647.000|CC1|MADE SOME DRUGS TOO STRONG, SOME
20110103030647.000|20110103030650.000|CC1|NOT STRONG ENOUGH.              
20110103030650.000|20110103030652.000|CC1|AND THE EMPLOYEES WERE          
20110103030652.000|20110103030654.000|CC1|CONTAMINATING PRODUCTS,         
20110103030654.000|20110103030656.000|CC1|INCLUDING THE ANTI-BACTERIAL    
20110103030656.000|20110103030657.000|CC1|OINTMENT BACTROBAN, WHICH WAS   
20110103030657.000|20110103030658.000|CC1|MADE IN A SEALED TANK TO PREVENT
20110103030658.000|20110103030702.000|CC1|CONTAMINATION.                  
20110103030702.000|20110103030703.000|CC1|>> Eckard: THEY WERE OPENING UP 
20110103030703.000|20110103030705.000|CC1|THE LID, AND THEN THEY WERE     
20110103030705.000|20110103030706.000|CC1|STICKING THEIR BODY INTO THE    
20110103030706.000|20110103030708.000|CC1|TANK AND SCRAPING IT WITH, LIKE,
20110103030708.000|20110103030710.000|CC1|A PADDLE.                       
20110103030710.000|20110103030711.000|CC1|>> Pelley: BUT THIS PRODUCT IS  
20110103030711.000|20110103030712.000|CC1|SUPPOSED TO BE FREE OF BACTERIA.
20110103030712.000|20110103030715.000|CC1|WHY WOULD THEY DO THAT?         
20110103030715.000|20110103030717.000|CC1|>> Eckard: IT SAVED MONEY.      
20110103030717.000|20110103030718.000|CC1|>> Pelley: AS HER TEAM CONTINUED
20110103030718.000|20110103030719.000|CC1|ITS EVALUATION OF THE PLANT,    
20110103030719.000|20110103030720.000|CC1|ECKARD SAYS SHE DISCOVERED      
20110103030720.000|20110103030720.000|CC1|SOMETHING MUCH WORSE THAN       
20110103030720.000|20110103030724.000|CC1|CONTAMINATION.                  
20110103030724.000|20110103030725.000|CC1|BECAUSE OF FAILURES ON VARIOUS  
20110103030725.000|20110103030727.000|CC1|PRODUCTION LINES, SHE SAYS THAT 
20110103030727.000|20110103030728.000|CC1|POWERFUL MEDICATIONS WERE       
20110103030728.000|20110103030731.000|CC1|GETTING MIXED UP.               
20110103030731.000|20110103030733.000|CC1|ARE YOU SAYING THAT DIFFERENT   
20110103030733.000|20110103030734.000|CC1|KINDS OF DRUGS WERE PACKED INTO 
20110103030734.000|20110103030734.000|CC1|THE SAME BOTTLE?                
20110103030734.000|20110103030735.000|CC1|>> Eckard: YES.                 
20110103030735.000|20110103030737.000|CC1|AND... AND THAT'S SHOCKING.     
20110103030737.000|20110103030738.000|CC1|>> Pelley: YES, IT IS.          
20110103030738.000|20110103030740.000|CC1|>> Eckard: THAT'S SHOCKING.     
20110103030740.000|20110103030741.000|CC1|>> Pelley: ECKARD SAYS THIS     
20110103030741.000|20110103030743.000|CC1|CHART THAT SHE PRODUCED FOR     
20110103030743.000|20110103030745.000|CC1|COMPANY EXECUTIVES SHOWS THE    
20110103030745.000|20110103030746.000|CC1|KINDS OF MIX-UPS THAT WERE      
20110103030746.000|20110103030749.000|CC1|HAPPENING AT CIDRA.             
20110103030749.000|20110103030751.000|CC1|SHE IDENTIFIED NINE, INCLUDING  
20110103030751.000|20110103030753.000|CC1|AVANDIA DIABETES PILLS MIXED IN 
20110103030753.000|20110103030756.000|CC1|PACKAGES WITH OVER-THE-COUNTER  
20110103030756.000|20110103030758.000|CC1|TAGAMET ANTACIDS, AND PAXIL     
20110103030758.000|20110103030801.000|CC1|ANTI-DEPRESSANTS MIXED WITH THE 
20110103030801.000|20110103030802.000|CC1|AVANDIA DIABETES DRUG.          
20110103030802.000|20110103030803.000|CC1|WHEN YOU SAW THESE MIX-UPS      
20110103030803.000|20110103030807.000|CC1|HAPPENING, WHAT DID YOU DO?     
20110103030807.000|20110103030808.000|CC1|>> Eckard: I CONTACTED THE VICE 
20110103030808.000|20110103030810.000|CC1|PRESIDENT OF QUALITY FOR NORTH  
20110103030810.000|20110103030811.000|CC1|AMERICA, AND I TOLD HIM THAT HE 
20110103030811.000|20110103030816.000|CC1|NEEDED TO SHUT DOWN THE FACTORY 
20110103030816.000|20110103030816.000|CC1|AND CALL THE F.D.A.             
20110103030816.000|20110103030817.000|CC1|>> Pelley: SHUT THE WHOLE THING 
20110103030817.000|20110103030817.000|CC1|DOWN?                           
20110103030817.000|20110103030819.000|CC1|>> Eckard: RIGHT.               
20110103030819.000|20110103030820.000|CC1|I URGED HIM TO STOP THE TRUCKS  
20110103030820.000|20110103030821.000|CC1|THAT WERE LEAVING THE DOCK THAT 
20110103030821.000|20110103030823.000|CC1|DAY.                            
20110103030823.000|20110103030826.000|CC1|>> Pelley: WHAT HAPPENED THEN?  
20110103030826.000|20110103030827.000|CC1|>> Eckard: I WENT BACK TO WORK  
20110103030827.000|20110103030830.000|CC1|AND WAITED FOR THE NEWS THAT    
20110103030830.000|20110103030833.000|CC1|THEY HAD CALLED THE F.D.A. OR   
20110103030833.000|20110103030840.000|CC1|THAT THEY HAD STOPPED SHIPMENTS.
20110103030840.000|20110103030843.000|CC1|AND IT DIDN'T HAPPEN.           
20110103030843.000|20110103030844.000|CC1|>> Pelley: ECKARD SAYS, AS THE  
20110103030844.000|20110103030846.000|CC1|MIX-UPS CONTINUED, A PHARMACIST 
20110103030846.000|20110103030847.000|CC1|CALLED THE COMPANY WITH A STORY 
20110103030847.000|20110103030849.000|CC1|ABOUT A MIX-UP INVOLVING THE    
20110103030849.000|20110103030851.000|CC1|POWERFUL ANTI-DEPRESSANT PAXIL  
20110103030851.000|20110103030854.000|CC1|IN ITS TEN-MILLIGRAM DOSE.      
20110103030854.000|20110103030855.000|CC1|THE PATIENT WAS AN EIGHT-YEAR-  
20110103030855.000|20110103030857.000|CC1|OLD BOY.                        
20110103030857.000|20110103030858.000|CC1|>> Eckard: A GRANDMOTHER CAME IN
20110103030858.000|20110103030859.000|CC1|TO PICK UP THIS LITTLE BOY'S    
20110103030859.000|20110103030901.000|CC1|PRESCRIPTION.                   
20110103030901.000|20110103030904.000|CC1|AND IN FRONT OF THE PHARMACIST, 
20110103030904.000|20110103030906.000|CC1|SHE OPENED UP THE BOTTLE.       
20110103030906.000|20110103030907.000|CC1|SHE TORE OFF THE INDUCTION SEAL 
20110103030907.000|20110103030908.000|CC1|AND SHE LOOKED AT IT.           
20110103030908.000|20110103030910.000|CC1|AND SHE BECAME UPSET.           
20110103030910.000|20110103030911.000|CC1|AND SHE SAID, "I KNEW IT.       
20110103030911.000|20110103030913.000|CC1|HIS MEDICINE HAS ALWAYS BEEN    
20110103030913.000|20110103030915.000|CC1|YELLOW.                         
20110103030915.000|20110103030916.000|CC1|BUT LAST MONTH, IT WAS PINK.    
20110103030916.000|20110103030918.000|CC1|AND HE'S BEEN SO SICK."         
20110103030918.000|20110103030919.000|CC1|>> Pelley: AND WHAT DID THAT    
20110103030919.000|20110103030922.000|CC1|MEAN, THE YELLOW AND THE PINK?  
20110103030922.000|20110103030924.000|CC1|>> Eckard: PAXIL TEN-MILLIGRAM  
20110103030924.000|20110103030925.000|CC1|IS YELLOW.                      
20110103030925.000|20110103030927.000|CC1|IT'S NOT PINK.                  
20110103030927.000|20110103030928.000|CC1|>> Pelley: THERE IS A VERSION OF
20110103030928.000|20110103030930.000|CC1|PAXIL THAT IS PINK.             
20110103030930.000|20110103030932.000|CC1|PAXIL CR IS 25 MILLIGRAMS.      
20110103030932.000|20110103030934.000|CC1|IF THAT'S WHAT THE PILLS WERE,  
20110103030934.000|20110103030935.000|CC1|THE BOY WAS GETTING TWO AND A   
20110103030935.000|20110103030937.000|CC1|HALF TIMES HIS PRESCRIBED DOSE. 
20110103030937.000|20110103030939.000|CC1|ECKARD SAYS THAT SHE ASSIGNED   
20110103030939.000|20110103030942.000|CC1|ONE OF HER INVESTIGATORS TO THE 
20110103030942.000|20110103030943.000|CC1|CASE, AND FOUND THAT BOTH PAXIL 
20110103030943.000|20110103030945.000|CC1|DOSES WERE MADE ON ONE          
20110103030945.000|20110103030947.000|CC1|PRODUCTION LINE, WHICH LED HER  
20110103030947.000|20110103030948.000|CC1|TO A THEORY OF HOW THE MIX-UP   
20110103030948.000|20110103030951.000|CC1|COULD HAVE HAPPENED.            
20110103030951.000|20110103030952.000|CC1|>> Eckard: MAYBE THERE WAS STILL
20110103030952.000|20110103030954.000|CC1|PAXIL IN THE HOPPER, THE FILLING
20110103030954.000|20110103030956.000|CC1|HOPPER, WHEN THEY SWITCHED OUT  
20110103030956.000|20110103030957.000|CC1|THE BOTTLES AND CHANGED OUT THE 
20110103030957.000|20110103030959.000|CC1|LABELS.                         
20110103030959.000|20110103031005.000|CC1|SO IN THAT BATCH, SOME OF THE   
20110103031005.000|20110103031006.000|CC1|FIRST BOTTLES THAT WENT THROUGH 
20110103031006.000|20110103031007.000|CC1|WERE LABELED TEN MILLIGRAM WHEN 
20110103031007.000|20110103031008.000|CC1|THEY WERE ACTUALLY 25.          
20110103031008.000|20110103031009.000|CC1|>> Pelley: SHE SAYS SHE TOOK HER
20110103031009.000|20110103031010.000|CC1|FINDINGS TO THE SAME VICE       
20110103031010.000|20110103031011.000|CC1|PRESIDENT THAT SHE HAD ASKED TO 
20110103031011.000|20110103031012.000|CC1|SHUT DOWN THE PLANT FIVE MONTHS 
20110103031012.000|20110103031013.000|CC1|BEFORE.                         
20110103031013.000|20110103031015.000|CC1|>> Eckard: I TOOK IT AND I      
20110103031015.000|20110103031017.000|CC1|HANDED IT TO HIM AND I SAID TO  
20110103031017.000|20110103031020.000|CC1|HIM, YOU KNOW, "READ THIS."     
20110103031020.000|20110103031022.000|CC1|AND HE PUT HIS... HE PUT HIS    
20110103031022.000|20110103031025.000|CC1|HEAD DOWN AND PUT HIS HANDS OVER
20110103031025.000|20110103031026.000|CC1|HIS FACE AND HE SAID, "OH, MY   
20110103031026.000|20110103031028.000|CC1|GOD, OH, MY GOD."               
20110103031028.000|20110103031029.000|CC1|>> Pelley: DID THEY SHUT DOWN   
20110103031029.000|20110103031030.000|CC1|THE PLANT THEN?                 
20110103031030.000|20110103031036.000|CC1|>> Eckard: NO, THEY FILED A     
20110103031036.000|20110103031037.000|CC1|REPORT WITH THE F.D.A. THAT SAID
20110103031037.000|20110103031038.000|CC1|THAT THE MIX-UP WAS NOT REAL,   
20110103031038.000|20110103031038.000|CC1|AND DID NOT HAPPEN AT THE       
20110103031038.000|20110103031039.000|CC1|FACTORY.                        
20110103031039.000|20110103031041.000|CC1|WE ALL KNEW, THEY ALL KNEW IT   
20110103031041.000|20110103031045.000|CC1|WAS REAL.                       
20110103031045.000|20110103031048.000|CC1|>> Pelley: THE GLAXO REPORT TO  
20110103031048.000|20110103031049.000|CC1|THE F.D.A. CHERYL ECKARD IS     
20110103031049.000|20110103031050.000|CC1|TALKING ABOUT SAID IT WAS       
20110103031050.000|20110103031051.000|CC1|"EXTREMELY UNLIKELY" THE PAXIL  
20110103031051.000|20110103031054.000|CC1|MIX-UP OCCURRED AT CIDRA.

20110103031055.000|20110103031057.000|CC1|THE BOY BECAUSE DRUG INCIDENT   
20110103031057.000|20110103031101.000|CC1|REPORTS DON'T CONTAIN NAMES, BUT
20110103031101.000|20110103031102.000|CC1|THE GLAXO NOTE TO THE F.D.A.    
20110103031102.000|20110103031103.000|CC1|SAID "THERE WERE NO ADVERSE     
20110103031103.000|20110103031104.000|CC1|REACTIONS."

20110103031109.000|20110103031111.000|CC1|TALK WITH US.

20110103031112.000|20110103031114.000|CC1|ALLEGATIONS.                    
20110103031114.000|20110103031118.000|CC1|AND IT DENIES THAT IT EVER LIED 
20110103031118.000|20110103031119.000|CC1|TO THE F.D.A.

20110103031120.000|20110103031120.000|CC1|TO TELL US THAT IT HAS LEARNED  
20110103031120.000|20110103031122.000|CC1|FROM CIDRA.                     
20110103031122.000|20110103031124.000|CC1|IAN McCUBBIN IS A SENIOR VICE   
20110103031124.000|20110103031125.000|CC1|PRESIDENT FROM GLAXO            
20110103031125.000|20110103031127.000|CC1|HEADQUARTERS IN LONDON.         
20110103031127.000|20110103031128.000|CC1|>> Ian McCubbin: WE REGRET WHAT 
20110103031128.000|20110103031129.000|CC1|HAPPENED IN CIDRA.              
20110103031129.000|20110103031130.000|CC1|BUT WE'VE WORKED REALLY, REALLY 
20110103031130.000|20110103031133.000|CC1|HARD TO RESOLVE THOSE ISSUES.   
20110103031133.000|20110103031134.000|CC1|WE SPEND $600 MILLION EVERY YEAR
20110103031134.000|20110103031135.000|CC1|ON MAKE SURE THAT OUR PLANT AND 
20110103031135.000|20110103031137.000|CC1|EQUIPMENT IS STATE OF THE ART.  
20110103031137.000|20110103031138.000|CC1|>> Pelley: WOULD YOU SAY THAT   
20110103031138.000|20110103031139.000|CC1|THE COMPANY WAS CHASTENED BY ALL

20110103031144.000|20110103031145.000|CC1|THAT THIS OCCURRED AND THAT WE

20110103031148.000|20110103031149.000|CC1|BUT WE'VE LEARNED FROM IT.      
20110103031149.000|20110103031150.000|CC1|AND WHAT YOU LEARN FROM, YOU    
20110103031150.000|20110103031151.000|CC1|BECOME STRONGER.                
20110103031151.000|20110103031152.000|CC1|>> Pelley: YOU HAVE HOW MANY    
20110103031152.000|20110103031153.000|CC1|PLANTS AROUND WORLD?            
20110103031153.000|20110103031153.000|CC1|>> McCubbin: WE HAVE AROUND 80  
20110103031153.000|20110103031155.000|CC1|PLANTS AROUND THE WORLD NOW.    
20110103031155.000|20110103031155.000|CC1|>> Pelley: DO ANY OF THEM       
20110103031155.000|20110103031157.000|CC1|OPERATE THE WAY CIDRA DID?      
20110103031157.000|20110103031158.000|CC1|>> McCubbin: ABSOLUTELY NOT.    
20110103031158.000|20110103031159.000|CC1|>> Pelley: SO HOW DID CIDRA GO  
20110103031159.000|20110103031201.000|CC1|WRONG?                          
20110103031201.000|20110103031202.000|CC1|>> McCubbin: THEY ALL OPERATED  
20110103031202.000|20110103031203.000|CC1|TO THE SAME STANDARD, TO THE    
20110103031203.000|20110103031204.000|CC1|SAME QUALITY SYSTEM THAT WE HAD 
20110103031204.000|20110103031207.000|CC1|IN PLACE.                       
20110103031207.000|20110103031208.000|CC1|THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN CIDRA AND
20110103031208.000|20110103031210.000|CC1|ALL THE REST OF THE PLANTS IS   
20110103031210.000|20110103031210.000|CC1|THE EFFECTIVENESS WITH WHICH    
20110103031210.000|20110103031211.000|CC1|THAT QUALITY SYSTEM WAS         
20110103031211.000|20110103031213.000|CC1|IMPLEMENTED.                    
20110103031213.000|20110103031215.000|CC1|IT WAS MUCH WEAKER, AND THAT    
20110103031215.000|20110103031215.000|CC1|RESULTED IN THE COMPLIANCE      
20110103031215.000|20110103031217.000|CC1|ISSUES THAT OCCURRED.           
20110103031217.000|20110103031218.000|CC1|>> Pelley: CHERYL ECKARD SAYS   
20110103031218.000|20110103031218.000|CC1|THAT SHE WAS ISSUING WARNINGS   
20110103031218.000|20110103031221.000|CC1|AND NO ONE WAS LISTENING.       
20110103031221.000|20110103031223.000|CC1|>> McCubbin: I DON'T KNOW CHERYL
20110103031223.000|20110103031224.000|CC1|ECKARD, AND I DON'T ALL THE     
20110103031224.000|20110103031229.000|CC1|DETAILS OF HER ACCUSATIONS.     
20110103031229.000|20110103031232.000|CC1|WHAT I DO KNOW IS THAT WE WERE  
20110103031232.000|20110103031233.000|CC1|WORKING WITH THE F.D.A. BEFORE  
20110103031233.000|20110103031237.000|CC1|CHERYL WENT TO THAT PLANT.      
20110103031237.000|20110103031238.000|CC1|>> Pelley: IT WAS AN F.D.A.     
20110103031238.000|20110103031239.000|CC1|INSPECTION THAT FIRST REVEALED  
20110103031239.000|20110103031241.000|CC1|PROBLEMS AT CIDRA, AND THAT'S

20110103031245.000|20110103031246.000|CC1|TO RESOLVE THOSE F.D.A.         
20110103031246.000|20110103031247.000|CC1|CONCERNS.

20110103031249.000|20110103031251.000|CC1|MORE THAN THE F.D.A. DID.

20110103031252.000|20110103031254.000|CC1|PLANTS ARE ONLY OCCASIONAL, SO  
20110103031254.000|20110103031255.000|CC1|IT'S UP TO DRUG COMPANIES TO    
20110103031255.000|20110103031256.000|CC1|POLICE THEMSELVES.              
20110103031256.000|20110103031257.000|CC1|>> Dr. Jerry Avorn: PROBABLY,   
20110103031257.000|20110103031258.000|CC1|MOST DRUGS ARE SAFE THAT PEOPLE 
20110103031258.000|20110103031259.000|CC1|ARE TAKING, BUT THERE ARE SCARY 
20110103031259.000|20110103031300.000|CC1|EXAMPLES LIKE THIS THAT         
20110103031300.000|20110103031301.000|CC1|CERTAINLY RAISE QUESTIONS.      
20110103031301.000|20110103031302.000|CC1|>> Pelley: DR. JERRY AVORN OF   
20110103031302.000|20110103031304.000|CC1|HARVARD MEDICAL SCHOOL IS ONE OF
20110103031304.000|20110103031304.000|CC1|THE NATION'S LEADING AUTHORITIES
20110103031304.000|20110103031306.000|CC1|ON PHARMACEUTICALS.             
20110103031306.000|20110103031308.000|CC1|HE SAYS THAT ECKARD'S STORY IS  
20110103031308.000|20110103031310.000|CC1|AN EXTRAORDINARY LOOK AT WHAT   
20110103031310.000|20110103031311.000|CC1|CAN HAPPEN WHEN THERE AREN'T    
20110103031311.000|20110103031314.000|CC1|ENOUGH INVESTIGATORS TO FOLLOW  
20110103031314.000|20110103031316.000|CC1|UP ON THE FEDERAL INSPECTIONS.  
20110103031316.000|20110103031318.000|CC1|>> Avorn: THE FACT THAT THERE   
20110103031318.000|20110103031319.000|CC1|WERE SO MANY DIFFERENT KINDS OF 
20110103031319.000|20110103031321.000|CC1|PROBLEMS, AND THAT THERE WERE   
20110103031321.000|20110103031322.000|CC1|EVEN OTHER ISSUES ABOUT DIABETES
20110103031322.000|20110103031323.000|CC1|DRUGS AND ANTIDEPRESSANTS ON THE
20110103031323.000|20110103031324.000|CC1|SAME LINE GETTING ALLEGEDLY     
20110103031324.000|20110103031325.000|CC1|MIXED TOGETHER, THE STERILITY   
20110103031325.000|20110103031326.000|CC1|ISSUES.                         
20110103031326.000|20110103031330.000|CC1|IT SPEAKS OF A REALLY PRETTY    
20110103031330.000|20110103031333.000|CC1|CHAOTIC, OUT-OF-CONTROL         
20110103031333.000|20110103031334.000|CC1|MANUFACTURING PROCESS.          
20110103031334.000|20110103031334.000|CC1|THIS WAS NOT, APPARENTLY, ONE   
20110103031334.000|20110103031335.000|CC1|ISOLATED INCIDENT.              
20110103031335.000|20110103031336.000|CC1|IT JUST LOOKS LIKE NOBODY WAS   
20110103031336.000|20110103031339.000|CC1|MINDING THE STORE AT THIS PLANT.
20110103031339.000|20110103031340.000|CC1|>> Pelley: WHAT DO YOU SAY TO   
20110103031340.000|20110103031341.000|CC1|SOMEONE WHO SAYS, "WELL, THE    
20110103031341.000|20110103031342.000|CC1|DRUG MANUFACTURING PROCESS IS   
20110103031342.000|20110103031343.000|CC1|VERY COMPLICATED, VERY HARD TO  
20110103031343.000|20110103031343.000|CC1|DO.                             
20110103031343.000|20110103031345.000|CC1|THERE ARE BOUND TO BE MISTAKES."
20110103031345.000|20110103031346.000|CC1|>> Avorn: JUST BECAUSE SOMETHING
20110103031346.000|20110103031347.000|CC1|IS COMPLICATED DOESN'T MEAN IT'S
20110103031347.000|20110103031349.000|CC1|OKAY TO GET IT WRONG.           
20110103031349.000|20110103031350.000|CC1|WE DON'T ACCEPT THAT OF OUR     
20110103031350.000|20110103031352.000|CC1|BRAIN SURGEONS OR OF OUR        
20110103031352.000|20110103031354.000|CC1|AIRLINES, OR OF OTHER           
20110103031354.000|20110103031355.000|CC1|COMPLICATED THINGS IN SOCIETY.  
20110103031355.000|20110103031357.000|CC1|THE REASON WE PAY SO MUCH FOR   
20110103031357.000|20110103031359.000|CC1|DRUGS, MORE THAN ANY OTHER      
20110103031359.000|20110103031401.000|CC1|COUNTRY, IS THAT WE EXPECT THAT,
20110103031401.000|20110103031402.000|CC1|IN EXCHANGE FOR THOSE HIGH      
20110103031402.000|20110103031403.000|CC1|PRICES, THE COMPANIES ARE GOING 
20110103031403.000|20110103031404.000|CC1|TO ACTUALLY MANAGE THEIR        
20110103031404.000|20110103031405.000|CC1|MANUFACTURING PROCESSES         
20110103031405.000|20110103031407.000|CC1|CAREFULLY.                      
20110103031407.000|20110103031408.000|CC1|>> Pelley: CHERYL ECKARD SAYS   
20110103031408.000|20110103031411.000|CC1|HER FIRST WARNING TO SHUT DOWN  
20110103031411.000|20110103031413.000|CC1|THE PLANT AT CIDRA CAME IN      
20110103031413.000|20110103031414.000|CC1|AUGUST, 2002.                   
20110103031414.000|20110103031415.000|CC1|SHE CONTINUED TO WORK, SEVEN    
20110103031415.000|20110103031416.000|CC1|DAYS A WEEK, REPORTING TO       
20110103031416.000|20110103031417.000|CC1|EXECUTIVES, BUT NOTHING SEEMED  
20110103031417.000|20110103031418.000|CC1|TO BE CHANGING ON THE FACTORY   
20110103031418.000|20110103031419.000|CC1|FLOOR.                          
20110103031419.000|20110103031420.000|CC1|AND THE FRUSTRATION WAS TAKING  
20110103031420.000|20110103031422.000|CC1|ITS TOLL.                       
20110103031422.000|20110103031424.000|CC1|>> Eckard: THE DIRECTOR OF      
20110103031424.000|20110103031425.000|CC1|MANUFACTURING AT THE FACTORY,   
20110103031425.000|20110103031427.000|CC1|MAYBE HE WAS THE V.P. OF        
20110103031427.000|20110103031429.000|CC1|MANUFACTURING AT THE FACTORY, HE
20110103031429.000|20110103031430.000|CC1|PULLED ME ASIDE AND SAID, "WE   
20110103031430.000|20110103031431.000|CC1|CAN ALL TELL THAT YOU'VE BEEN   
20110103031431.000|20110103031438.000|CC1|CRYING.                         
20110103031438.000|20110103031440.000|CC1|YOU COME HERE EVERY DAY AND YOUR
20110103031440.000|20110103031443.000|CC1|EYES ARE SWOLLEN BECAUSE YOU'VE 
20110103031443.000|20110103031446.000|CC1|BEEN CRYING.                    
20110103031446.000|20110103031447.000|CC1|SO I WANT TO ASK YOU TO STOP    
20110103031447.000|20110103031449.000|CC1|THAT."                          
20110103031449.000|20110103031450.000|CC1|AND I SAID TO HIM, "YOU KNOW, I 
20110103031450.000|20110103031451.000|CC1|DO CRY.                         
20110103031451.000|20110103031452.000|CC1|I CRY AT NIGHT.                 
20110103031452.000|20110103031454.000|CC1|I CRY IN THE MORNING.           
20110103031454.000|20110103031455.000|CC1|AND WHAT I DON'T UNDERSTAND IS  
20110103031455.000|20110103031457.000|CC1|WHY I'M THE ONLY ONE.           
20110103031457.000|20110103031500.000|CC1|WHY AREN'T YOU CRYING?"         
20110103031500.000|20110103031502.000|CC1|>> Pelley: AFTER EIGHT MONTHS OF
20110103031502.000|20110103031503.000|CC1|REPORTING PROBLEMS AT CIDRA,    
20110103031503.000|20110103031506.000|CC1|ECKARD SENT THIS SUMMARY TO     
20110103031506.000|20110103031507.000|CC1|SEVEN EXECUTIVES, DETAILING NINE
20110103031507.000|20110103031510.000|CC1|HIGH-RISK AREAS AT THE PLANT,   
20110103031510.000|20110103031511.000|CC1|INCLUDING THE MIX-UPS, THE WATER
20110103031511.000|20110103031512.000|CC1|CONTAMINATION, AND THE PROBLEMS 
20110103031512.000|20110103031517.000|CC1|WITH STERILITY.                 
20110103031517.000|20110103031518.000|CC1|SHE WARNED THAT IF THE F.D.A.   
20110103031518.000|20110103031519.000|CC1|KNEW WHAT THE COMPANY KNEW, THE 
20110103031519.000|20110103031519.000|CC1|GOVERNMENT COULD SEIZE THE      
20110103031519.000|20110103031520.000|CC1|FACTORY.                        
20110103031520.000|20110103031521.000|CC1|WEEKS LATER, SHE WAS OUT OF A   
20110103031521.000|20110103031523.000|CC1|JOB.                            
20110103031523.000|20110103031526.000|CC1|GLAXO SAID IT WAS DOWNSIZING.   
20110103031526.000|20110103031527.000|CC1|STILL WORRIED ABOUT PATIENT     
20110103031527.000|20110103031529.000|CC1|SAFETY, ECKARD TOOK THE SAME    
20110103031529.000|20110103031530.000|CC1|INFORMATION SHE'D SENT TO HER   
20110103031530.000|20110103031533.000|CC1|GLAXO BOSSES AND TURNED IT OVER 
20110103031533.000|20110103031535.000|CC1|TO THE F.D.A.

20110103032415.000|20110103032418.000|CC1|MUSIC BUSINESS.                 
20110103032418.000|20110103032420.000|CC1|THAT MAKES YOU, IN A CERTAIN    
20110103032420.000|20110103032421.000|CC1|WAY, A VERY YOUNG ELDER         
20110103032421.000|20110103032424.000|CC1|STATESMAN.                      
20110103032424.000|20110103032424.000|CC1|>> Marsalis: I DON'T FEEL LIKE  
20110103032424.000|20110103032426.000|CC1|THAT.

20110103032427.000|20110103032429.000|CC1|CALLED ME AN OLD MAN SINCE I WAS
20110103032429.000|20110103032431.000|CC1|IN MY LATE 20s.

20110103032435.000|20110103032437.000|CC1|LEGEND, WHO PASSED THE JAZZ GENE

20110103032438.000|20110103032442.000|CC1|FIVE BROTHERS.

20110103033126.000|20110103033128.000|CC1|BERLIN PHILHARMONIC PLAYED THE

20110103033139.000|20110103033141.000|CC1|? ? ?                           
20110103033141.000|20110103033143.000|CC1|DOES IT SADDEN YOU THAT, FOR THE
20110103033143.000|20110103033144.000|CC1|MOST PART, YOUNG PEOPLE MAY NOT 
20110103033144.000|20110103033145.000|CC1|EVEN KNOW WHO YOU'RE TALKING

20110103033147.000|20110103033148.000|CC1|PARKER" OR "DUKE ELLINGTON"?    
20110103033148.000|20110103033149.000|CC1|>> Marsalis: IT SADDENS ME THAT 
20110103033149.000|20110103033151.000|CC1|PEOPLE MY AGE MAY NOT KNOW THAT.
20110103033151.000|20110103033152.000|CC1|AND IT'S A COMMENT ON THE       
20110103033152.000|20110103033153.000|CC1|FAILURE OF OUR EDUCATION SYSTEM 
20110103033153.000|20110103033154.000|CC1|TO DEAL WITH CULTURAL EDUCATION.
20110103033154.000|20110103033155.000|CC1|NOT JUST DUKE ELLINGTON-- WALT  
20110103033155.000|20110103033156.000|CC1|WHITMAN, THE LIST GOES ON AND   
20110103033156.000|20110103033200.000|CC1|ON.                             
20110103033200.000|20110103033201.000|CC1|SO IT SADDENS ME FOR US AS A    
20110103033201.000|20110103033201.000|CC1|NATION.                         
20110103033201.000|20110103033202.000|CC1|BECAUSE WE HAVE SUCH A RICH     
20110103033202.000|20110103033204.000|CC1|CULTURAL HERITAGE, AND WE WOULD 
20110103033204.000|20110103033205.000|CC1|BE SO MUCH THE BETTER FOR IT AND
